item.title: Goldman has record trading days
item.description: Goldman Sachs traders made more than $100m in revenues on each of a record 46 days during the second quarter, while losing money on just two days, the bank said, in a filing that underscored the strength of its trading operations.

item.title: Survey finds US job losses slowed in July
item.description: US companies cut a worse-than-expected 371,000 jobs last month, but the haemorrhaging of jobs across the economy continues to slow

item.title: Wall Street falls on bleak data
item.description: US stocks were lower in afternoon trade, but the benchmark S&P 500 index was holding above 1,000 as the market pared some losses sparked by two pieces ofdownbeat economic data

item.title: When Bill went to Pyongyang
item.description: Washington must decide what it can realistically demand of Pyongyang in terms of nuclear commitments. Then it should stick to that position and not budge one iota until North Korea complies

item.title: CF Industries to raise Terra offer
item.description: Fertilizer maker CF Industries Holdings Inc said it would raise its offer for rival Terra Industries Inc , which has rebuffed earlier bids.

item.title: Dollar pressures weigh on P&G
item.description: The world’s largest consumer goods company saw its unit volume sales drop 4% in its fourth quarter, as price rises due to the strong dollar hit overseas sales and global consumer demand remained sluggish

item.title: US faces huge bill for Afghan security
item.description: The US will have to provide billions more dollars in coming years to finance a huge increase in the size of Afghanistan’s security forces, officials and analysts warn

item.title: Deutsche Bank in Sal Oppenheim stake talks
item.description: Deutsche Bank is in advanced talks on taking a minority stake in private bank Sal Oppenheim in a deal designed to boost its wealthy client business

item.title: Lloyds reports first-half loss of £4bn
item.description: The bank, partly owned by the UK government, reported a pro forma loss of £4bn as the deteriorating state of its loan portfolio led it to take £13.4bn of impairment charges in the first half

item.title: Clashes mark inauguration of Iran president
item.description: Security forces clashed with hundreds of protesters outside parliament as Mahmoud Ahmadi-Nejad was sworn in as Iran’s president
